text.0: laid like an arrow on the bow the hymn hath been loosed like a young calf to the udder of its dam.
text.1: as one who cometh first with full stream she is milked the soma is impelled to this mans holy rites.
text.2: the thought is deeply fixed the savoury juice is shed the tongue with joyous sound is stirring in the mouth.
text.3: and pavamana like the shout of combatants the drop rising in sweet juice is flowing through the fleece.
text.4: he flows about the sheepskin longing for a bride he looses aditis daughters for the worshipper.
text.5: the sacred drink hath come goldtinted wellrestrained like a strong bull he shines whetting his manly might.
text.6: the bull is bellowing the cows are coming nigh the goddesses approach the gods own restingplace.
text.7: onward hath soma passed through the sheeps fair bright fleece and hath as twere endued a garment newly washed.
text.8: the goldenhued immortal newly bathed puts on a brightly shining vesture that is never harmed.
text.9: he made the ridge of heaven to be his radiant robe by sprinkling of the bowls from moisture of the sky.
text.10: even as the beams of sūrya urging men to speed that cheer and send to sleep together rush they forth.
text.11: these swift outpourings in long course of holy rites no form save only indra shows itself so pure.
text.12: as down the steep slope of a river to the vale drawn from the steer the swift strong draughts have found a way.
text.13: well be it with the men and cattle in our home may powers o soma may the people stay with us.
text.14: pour out upon us wealth in goods in gold in steeds in cattle and in corn and great heroic strength.
text.15: ye soma are my fathers lifted up on high as heads of heaven and makers of the strength of life.
text.16: these pavamanas here these drops of soma to indra have sped forth like cars to booty.
text.17: effused they pass the cleansing fleece while goldhued they cast their covering off to pour the rain down.
text.18: o indu flow thou on for lofty indra flow blameless very gracious foedestroyer.
text.19: bring splendid treasures to the man who lauds thee o heaven and earth with all the gods protect us.
